title: `[ink_e2e]` method to generate and fund unique accounts
body:
Allows individual tests to generate their own unique accounts to avoid the problem of race conditions between tests using the same account, causing failures in #1591.

Can consider integrating this into the environment somehow, but for now providing the method is a good start.

:warning: The commit history and file diff in this PR view is messed up, due to it being originally based off #1512 and #1591, and my failing to rebase onto `master`. So this PR view shows commits and changes from those PRs. 
For the clean diff see the commit view https://github.com/paritytech/ink/commit/8321e6fe43f9e895971271d5ac07e13b05a8d65c :warning:

title: chore: add minimum rust version to the ink crate, refs #1606
Update `ARCHITECTURE.md`
body:
[Preview here](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/blob/cmichi-update-architecture-md/ARCHITECTURE.md)

I would like to link docs for the E2E framework, but we don't have them yet. Will do so once we have.

title: Rename `CallBuilder::fire()` method to `invoke()`
body:
The name of this has always been a bit inconsistent to me since we're calling
`CallParams::invoke` and `ink_env::invoke_contract` under the hood.

While we're breaking stuff before the release I figured it would be a good time to make
the naming here more consistent.

title: Add `SECURITY.md`
body: cc @pavelsupr

title: Make `CallBuilder` and `CreateBuilder` error handling optional
body:
This is a follow-up related to [this](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/1525#discussion_r1073940032) comment.

We're updating the default APIs to unwrap any errors from the Contracts pallet, and
adding some new APIs in case callers do want to handle the errors.

~~I've also made a drive-by change to rename the `fire()` method to `invoke()`. This keeps
things consistent since we're wrapping a few methods with `invoke` in the name anyways.~~

_Decided to do this in a follow-up. It's gonna make it easier for people to spot the breaking change.
Plus, extra green squares 🧑‍🌾_

The breaking changes have been noted in the `CHANGELOG`.

title: Update secp256k1 requirement from 0.25.0 to 0.26.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Updates the requirements on [secp256k1](https://github.com/rust-bitcoin/rust-secp256k1) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from secp256k1's changelog.

0.26.0 - 2202-12-19

  • Update libsecp25k1 to v0.2.0

0.25.0 - 2022-12-07

  • Fix soundness issue with preallocated_gen_new
  • Update to secp256k1-sys v0.7.0
  • Use type system to improve safety.
  • Change secp256k1-sys symbol names to 0_6_1.
  • Introduce rustfmt to the codebase.
  • Make all raw pointer methods go through the CPtr trait.
  • Make comparison functions stable.

0.24.1 - 2022-10-25

  • Fix broken deserialization logic of KeyPair that previously always panicked. After the patch deserialization only panics if neither the global-context nor the alloc (default) feature is active.

0.24.0 - 2022-07-20

  • Upgrade to new release of bitcoin_hashes.

0.23.4 - 2022-07-14

  • Disable automatic rerandomization of contexts under WASM

0.23.3 - 2022-06-29

  • Add must_use for mut self key manipulation methods
  • Fix fuzzing feature guard

0.23.2 - 2022-06-27

  • Move cbor to dev-dependencies
  • Derive Hash for RecoverableSignature

0.23.1 - 2022-06-24

Enable "rand/std_rng" feature when the crate's "rnd-std" feature is enabled.

0.23.0 - 2022-06-21

The major change in this version is the increase of the Minimum Supported Rust Version (MSRV) from 1.29 to 1.41.1, this is a big change because it introduces Rust Edition 2018 to the codebase along with all the benefits that brings.

Breaking changes

  • MSRV bumped to 1.41.1 and edition changed to 2018
  • serde implements serialize fixed-width arrays as tuples in binary formats to avoid encoding the length
  • Key tweaking methods renamed and refactored to use a more functional-style, they now accept a new Scalar type instead of raw slices
  • Update rand dependency to 0.8

... (truncated)

Commits

title: Unify fallible and non fallible instantiate methods
body:
Context: https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/1512#discussion_r1041508207

Since https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/1512 `CreateBuilder` has 4 different `instantiate` methods:

`instantiate`
`instantiate_fallible`
`try_instantiate`
`try_instantiate_faillble`

The use case for this is when we have a "fallible" constructor which returns a `Result` e.g.

```rust
#[ink(constructor)]
pub fn new() -> Result<Self, Error> {
    Ok(Self {})
}
```
In order to invoke this from another contract, the following is required:
```rust
ContractRef::new()
            .code_hash(ink_primitives::Clear::CLEAR_HASH)
            .gas_limit(4000)
            .endowment(25)
            .salt_bytes([0xDE, 0xAD, 0xBE, 0xEF])
            .instantiate_fallible() // must call this because it returns a result.
            .unwrap()
```
Some issues with this approach:

1. Requires the user to know which variant of `instantiate` to call based on the return type of the constructor. Granted it should not compile with the wrong one, but still will cause some friction.
2. Code duplication all the way down, two versions of each `instantiate` method.

This PR unifies the `instantaite` and `instantiate_fallible` versions of each method call, such that the user only needs to call `instantiate` or `instantiate_fallible`, and the `CreateBuilder` method will return either `Result<ContranctRef>` or plain `ContractRef`, depending on the actual return type of the constructor.

See this [UI test](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/blob/698f7e3096c2f2a48a2942d163afa8555efee3e5/crates/ink/tests/ui/contract/pass/constructor-return-result-cross-contract.rs#L38) for the variations of constructor return types.

title: dependabot: fix ignoring substrate deps
body:
The `ignore` config from #1561 [don't seem to be working](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pulls?q=is%3Apr+sp-) to prevent dependabot PRs.

This PR moves the ignore section to the `cargo` `updates` section as per the example in the docs: https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/dependabot/dependabot-version-updates/configuration-options-for-the-dependabot.yml-file#ignore.

Also only ignores major updates since the automatic substrate releases process seems to do frequent major version bumps.

title: Added Debug trait for EmittedEvent
body: Issue raised in #1577. **Motivation**: **Solution**: Added a `Debug` trait for `EmittedEvent` to view the details in unit tests

body: `+nightly` missing in build commands, grammar fixes, etc.

title: Chain Extension: Evaluation of method return type at compile time
body:
This PR closes #952

It introduces breaking changes to chain extension macro API: **`returns_result` flag has been removed**
Since this PR, `Result<O, E>` return type is detected and handled at the compile time.

If `handle_status` is set to true, the return type will still be wrapped into `Result` as before.

Tasks:
- [x] Code cleanup
- [x] Docs

body:
Follow-up to [substrate#13007](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/13007).

As we don't have `__unstable__` wasm module anymore, stabilizing here is basically just removal of the warning from the docs.

title: Temporarily add `Determinism` enum from `pallet-contracts`
body:
[Recent](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate-contracts-node/releases/tag/v0.23.0) release of substrate-contracts-node introduce new parameter `determinism` in [`upload_code()`](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate-contracts-node/blob/87a3d76c88058667d8c028b886a5e404ef9a70ea/runtime/src/lib.rs#L567) which needs to be specified on the ink! and cargo-contract sides, otherwise no E2E tests can be run with the latest substrate-contracts-node version.
`pallet-contracts` currently do not expose `pallet_contracts::Determinism` publicly.
Therefore, the temporary solution is to copy-paste the enum into the ink! codebase until the next release of `polkadot` branch in substrate and synchronisation of substrate-contracts-node

title: Fixed compilation errors events
body:
- Fixed a small compilation error
- Applied fmt
- Merged with `master`

title: Unit tests for decoding reverted fallible constructors return type
body:
*WIP* Just extracts that block of code for decoding the `return_value` from a reverted constructor call, and add some unit tests.

For now I have not modified the implementation at all, I have just added some unit tests to try out the different scenarios.

Not necessarily suggesting this is how it should be factored, just extracted the method here for easy unit testing for now.

title: Fix trait message return type metadata
body:
Follow up to https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/1450, addresses the metadata part of https://github.com/paritytech/ink/issues/1530.

Messages now [return `Result<_, LangError>`.](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/blob/507d01dcb2848c3deb16691bac9ec0c15bcda900/crates/ink/codegen/src/generator/dispatch.rs#L837) The metadata was updated to reflect this for inherent methods but not for trait methods.

Note that as mentioned in the #1530, this *only* fixes the external metadata, and does not address the codegen for cross contract calling.

**Additionally** this PR copies a similar test for fallible constructor metadata from one of the compile tests, and allows it to use the helpers for extracting result types here.

title: Remove `set_balance()` from the off-chain test_api as a duplicate function
body: `ink::env::test::set_balance()` is just the same as `ink::env::test::set_account_balance()`. It was apparently mistakenly added during making the experimental off-chain engine the default one (see [ink#1144](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/1144/files#diff-d388925fdaa4ef71cf03648e80d5e087cbb248271c13a396dd7d09516e59c93eR190))

title: Bump `secp256k1` to `v0.24.2`
body:
Versions `>= 0.24.0` have a soundness bug, so we need to ensure people
are using `>= 0.24.2`

See here for more: https://github.com/rustsec/advisory-db/pull/1480

title: `[ink_e2e]` delete subxt metadata, use dynamic values
body:
Closes https://github.com/paritytech/ink/issues/1422.

Instead of downloading the metadata from the node, this PR removes the need for compile time metadata entirely.

The extrinsics themselves are already using locally defined types, the only remaining usage of the statically generated runtime types were:

1. Fetching an account balance
2. Detecting `ExtrinsicFailed` events

`1.` can be done using dynamic decoding to extract the `AccountInfo::data`, `AccountData::free` field.
`2.` can be done by just checking for the pallet and event variant name.

title: Clean up `CallBuilder` `return()` type
body:
In #1450 I had to change the return type used by `CallBuilder` callers in order to be
able to encode/decode the new `MessageResult` return type.

This PR bakes the assumption that all messages **must** return a `MessageResult` into the
into the `CallBuilder`'s call stack, allowing callers to specify only the message return
type again. I.e, instead of `returns::<Result<R, LangError>>()` you can again specify just
`returns::<R>()`.

A breaking change that ended up being introduced here is that `ink_env::invoke_contract` now
returns a `MessageResult<R>`, whereas it previously returned just `R`.

I'm not sure if we need to do anything for for the `DelegateCall` implementation, but we can
leave that as a follow-up since there are already examples of people stumbling due to (the
lack of) this: https://github.com/paritytech/ink-workshop/pull/31.

title: Update README.md
body: Update ink! doc link and removes mention of Canvas since the project has been archived

title: Migrate `erc20` waterfall test to e2e
body: Part of #1510

title: Handle `LangError` from instantiate
body:
This is a follow up to #1504, in which `LangError`s were returned from constructors. In
that PR we had no way to read the output buffer from `seal_instantiate` and bubble any 
information back up to the contract caller.

This PR adds support for reading this output buffer for both infallible and fallible
constructors.

Because of type checking problems I've had to add a new set of APIs for handling fallible
constructors. I'm still looking for a way to unify them, as mentioned in [this comment](https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/1512/files#r1041508207).
If you have any ideas for improvements here I'd be happy to hear them.

I've changed the `create_builder` API slightly to be more in-line with the `call_builder`
one (i.e removing the generic in favour of a `returns` method). 

For infallible constructors, the main changes are:
- The `CreateBuilder` now returns a `ConstructorResult` (introduced in #1504)
    - This can optionally be handled using the new `try_instantiate` method

For fallible constructors:
- We've added `intantiate_fallible` and `try_instantiate_fallible` `CreateBuilder` methods
    - Like above, `ConstructorError`s are only bubbled up in the `try_*` variant
    - Edit: This API is clunky, but Andrew's proposing a nicer solution in
      https://github.com/paritytech/ink/pull/1591
- We've added a new environment API, `ink_env::instantiate_fallible_contract`

I've also updated the codegen so that `ContractRef`s can be used to instantiate contracts,
as an alternative to the "raw" `CreateBuilder` API.

Notes for reviewers:
- Keep in mind that there are two ways that the output buffer of `seal_instantiate` can
  be written to:
    - By the ink! codegen
    - Manually by the callee contract using `ink_env::return_value`
        - This second one is the one we need to worry about since people can (on purpose
          or by accident) encode erroneous values in there
- Related to the above, make sure to take a close look at the different output buffer
  decoding scenarios
- Take a look at the E2E tests to see if they make sense
- Right now the E2E test fail in the CI, not because they're actually broken but because
  of #1498
  (run them locally if you don't believe me 😆)

title: Migrate `contract-terminate` waterfall test to e2e
body:
Part of #1510.

Migrates the `contract-terminate` test from `ink-waterfall` https://github.com/paritytech/ink-waterfall/blob/819b12969a068de10b7984e5ce9957f79a0a53a7/src/tests/contract_terminate.rs#L33.

Change the behaviour of the `ink_e2e::Client::call` method so that it does not panic if it fails to decode the dry run result. This is because `contract_terminate` never returns so no data is written to the output buffer, even though the call itself succeeds.

title: Add E2E tests for `Mapping` functions
body: This PR fixes #1488 and closes #1472 by adding E2E tests for all `Mapping` functions and correctly submitting the origin of the dry-run call during E2E test
